stanza.line: Alack what poverty my muse brings forth
That having such a scope to show herpride
The argument all bare is of more worth
Than when it hath my added praisebeside
O blame me not if I no more canwrite
Look in your glass and there appears aface
That over goes my blunt inventionquite
Dulling my lines and doing medisgrace
Were it not sinful then striving tomend
To mar the subject that before waswell
For to no other pass my versestend
Than of your graces and your gifts totell
And more much more than in my verse cansit
Your own glass shows you when you look init
